summary: Staged in the heart of Michigan's Upper Peninsula, the Rock River Canyon ultramarathon is a 50K journey through one of the state's most remote and pristine wilderness areas. Runners traverse a fast, out-and-back course that balances moderate elevation with 'Zen quality' single-track, providing an immersive experience in the silent, ancient forests south of Munising.
uniqueFeatures: The route explores a rarely followed section of the North Country Trail, taking participants through the secluded river valleys of the Rock River Canyon Wilderness.
With 26 miles of high-quality single-track and a runnable elevation profile, the race is specifically designed to be accessible for marathoners transitioning to their first ultra.
The event enforces a strict 100-runner cap to preserve the wilderness character and provide a uniquely solitary, introspective running experience.

media.contentSummary: A comprehensive weekly digest of global trail and ultramarathon results for the weekend of June 14, 2021. Key highlights include record-breaking performances by Maude Mathys and Stian Angermund at the Olla de Núria in Spain, the USATF 50k road national championships in New York won by Preston Johnson and Randi Burnett, and a world best performance by John Stocker at the Suffolk Backyard Ultra in the UK.
